alert.note: Alert for Washington (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 22 at 10:27AM CDT until April 24 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Iowa... English River at Kalona affecting Washington and Johnson Counties. For the English River...including Kalona...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON TO LATE SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...English River at Kalona. * WHEN...From Saturday afternoon to late Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Agricultural land along the river begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CDT Friday the stage was 5.3 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued this evening.
